alert.note: Alert for Shelby; St. Clair (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 7:42PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Shelby and St. Clair Counties through 845 PM CDT... At 742 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Ashville to Branchville to Birmingham to near West Blocton. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hoover, Alabaster, Pelham, Helena, Pell City, Leeds, Moody, Calera, Chelsea, Rainbow City, Montevallo, Columbiana, Springville, Odenville, Wilsonville, Lincoln, Margaret, Argo, Indian Springs Village and Ashville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for central, northeastern and east central Alabama.
